blocks.title: The Four Letters of Havayah
blocks.intro: The structure of divine flow through the Name Havayah (×™×”×•×”):

items.content: Yud â€” represents Chochmah (Wisdom). The initial flash of divine insight. Corresponds to the world of Atzilus. The smallest letter containing infinite potential.
Upper Hei â€” represents Binah (Understanding). The expansion and elaboration of the initial insight. The "mother" that gives birth to the emotions.
Vav â€” represents the six Middos (emotional attributes) from Chesed to Yesod. The vertical line connecting above to below. The six days of creation.
Lower Hei â€” represents Malchus (Kingship). How divinity is expressed in creation. Combined with the first letters of Elokim, it forms the Parsa.

blocks.title: Rambam vs. Aristotle â€” Two Responses to Knowledge
blocks.intro: A striking illustration of the difference between bittul and yeshus â€” why the orlah must be removed:

items.content: Aristotle's Response: Philosophical achievement increased his sense of self. "Look at what I have accomplished!" Knowledge fed his ego rather than humbling him. This is the essence of kelipah â€” acknowledgment of G-d that doesn't lead to transformation.

Rambam's Response: Philosophical understanding produced increased bittul. The more he understood G-d's greatness, the more he felt his own insignificance. Knowledge led him to "throw himself aside" completely. This is what circumcision enables.

blocks.outro: The orlah represents the capacity for spiritual knowledge without spiritual transformation â€” pure intellectualism devoid of bittul. Through milah, a Jew gains the capacity for knowledge to penetrate the heart and effect real change.

blocks.text: Key Parables â€” How Concealment Works

items.title: The Transformer
items.body: The Parsa functions like an electrical transformer stepping down voltage. Without it, the infinite light would overwhelm finite beings. The concealment enables reception â€” not obstruction.

items.title: The Magnifying Glass
items.body: The sandal-type concealment is like a magnifying glass between eye and object. It comes between â€” yet actually enhances vision. Concealment that reveals.

items.title: Sun Through Clouds
items.body: Havayah is the sun; Elokim is the clouds filtering its intensity. The clouds don't block the sun â€” they allow the earth to benefit from warmth without being scorched.

items.title: Building and Foundation
items.body: A tall building needs the deepest foundation. The akev (heel) â€” descending into realms of concealment â€” requires Kesser, which transcends all limitations, to sustain it.

items.title: Teacher and Student
items.body: A teacher must simplify concepts for a student. The divine light must be "contracted" to be received by limited beings. The concealment is pedagogical â€” not punitive.

items.title: Shoe and Ground
items.body: The minal l'sandalo (shoe for the sandal) protects the foot from the ground. There's an outer covering shielding the holy process from kelippos below â€” preventing corruption during descent.
